rComments: Awesome class and great professor.  One of the best at UCSC.  Sets grading criteria and tells you exactly what she expects which is great.  Class is really engaging and fun.  She encourages students to take the lead on discussions and always asks for feedback.  Makes the class really enjoyable and worthwhile.  Readings are interesting (mostly).

Great class, material can be dry at times but Professor Abdelaaty always keeps lectures interesting with film clips and pop culture references. Consists of two paper s, a midterm and a final. Section is always mandatory.

Her lectures are VERY organized and coherent. She provides interesting and exciting examples and sometimes incorporates music to illustrate her main lecture points. I strongly recommend her! Side note- be sure to pick a good TA. It really matters. My TA was terrible this quarter. Other than that, loved the class and professor.
Straightforward class and sticks to the syllabus. A few essays for midterms and a final essay. Participate and do the readings to help supplement lecture and you'll do good.

As with any politics class, there's lots of reading. Readings were a little dry, but interesting nonetheless. Its a paper writing class (no in class exams), whether or not this appeals to you depends on your preference. I really enjoyed the class, found the subject (forced migration) interesting, and professor Abdelaaty to be a gifted teacher.
